item.title: 美国加征关税，阿迪达斯和彪马预计将跟随耐克提高运动服装价格
item.description: 分析师和投资者周四表示，由于美国对进口商品征收关税导致零售商成本上升，阿迪达斯和彪马很可能效仿耐克，在美国提高跑步鞋和运动服的价格。【原文：Adidas and Puma are likely to hike prices for running shoes and sportswear in the United States, following Nike's lead, analysts and investors said on Thursday, as U.S. tariffs on imports drive costs up for retailers.】

item.title: 初创公司 Anthropic 称其新型人工智能模型可一次编码数小时
item.description: 人工智能实验室 Anthropic 周四发布了其最新的顶级技术 Claude Opus 4，称该技术可以连续数小时自主编写计算机代码。【原文：Artificial intelligence lab Anthropic on Thursday unveiled its latest top-of-the-line technology, Claude Opus 4, which it says can write computer code autonomously for hours at a time.】

item.title: 全球债券市场发出信号，各国政府必须支付更多的长期借款
item.description: 从乏善可陈的债务拍卖到长期债券价格的暴跌，投资者正在向各国政府发出一个明确的信息：在当前不确定的环境下，他们需要为未来几十年的借贷付出更多的代价。【原文：From ho-hum debt auctions to plunging long-term bond prices, investors are sending a clear message to governments that in the current climate of uncertainty they need to pay more to borrow for decades ahead.】

item.title: 广告技术平台 MNTN 在纳斯达克首秀表现抢眼，涨幅超过 31
item.description: 由瑞安-雷诺兹（Ryan Reynolds）担任首席创意官的互联网电视广告平台 MNTN 周四在纽约证券交易所上市，股价上涨了 31.25%，估值达到 16.2 亿美元，表明 IPO 市场继续保持复苏势头。【原文：MNTN , an advertising platform for internet-connected TVs which has Ryan Reynolds as its chief creative officer, secured a valuation of $1.62 billion after its shares gained 31.25% in its New York Stock Exchange debut on Thursday, signaling continued momentum in the recovering IPO market.】

item.title: 力拓广泛物色新任首席执行官，与必和必拓的强大阵容形成鲜明对比
item.description: 消息人士称，在力拓寻找新首席执行官的过程中，由于可能的内部候选人名单非常短，该矿商将广泛撒网，这与其主要竞争对手必和必拓（BHP）专注的继任计划形成了鲜明对比。【原文：As Rio Tinto , searches for a new CEO, the miner will cast a wide net due to a very short list of possible internal candidates, sources said, in contrast with laser-focused succession planning at its main rival BHP.】

item.title: 俄罗斯立法者主张有权无视西方公司回购方案
item.description: 俄罗斯立法者正在推动制定新规则，赋予国内公司无视与离开俄罗斯的西方公司达成的任何回购协议的权利，以控制战略部门并促进国内生产。【原文：Russian lawmakers are pushing for new rules to give domestic companies the right to ignore any buyback options they agreed with Western firms that left the country, to keep a grip on strategic sectors and promote domestic production.】

item.title: 国际清算银行数字货币中心负责人提前离职
item.description: 领导国际清算银行数字货币工作的前瑞典央行行长塞西莉亚-斯金斯利（Cecilia Skingsley）将提前两年离开这个总部设在瑞士的伞式机构，回国担任政府工作。【原文：The former Swedish central banker leading the Bank for International Settlements' work on digital currencies, Cecilia Skingsley, is to leave the Switzerland-based umbrella body two years early to take a government job back in her homeland.】

item.title: 据彭博法律报道，谷歌因人工智能技术交易面临司法部调查
item.description: 据彭博法律周四援引知情人士的话报道，美国司法部正在调查 Alphabet 旗下的谷歌与人工智能初创公司 Character.AI 达成的协议是否违反了反垄断法，该协议允许这家科技巨头使用聊天机器人制造商的技术。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department is probing whether Alphabet's Google violated antitrust law in its agreement with AI startup Character.AI that allows the tech giant to use the chatbot maker's technology, Bloomberg Law reported on Thursday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，埃及正在就购买 40-60 船液化天然气进行谈判
item.description: 三位知情人士告诉路透社，埃及正在与能源公司和贸易公司洽谈购买 40-60 船液化天然气（LNG）的事宜，因为在夏季需求高峰到来之前，埃及的能源紧缺状况正在恶化。【原文：Egypt is in talks with energy firms and trading houses to buy 40-60 cargoes of liquefied natural gas (LNG) amid a worsening energy crunch ahead of peak summer demand, three sources aware of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局（FAA）批准太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）的 "星际飞船 "火箭复飞
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局周四表示，已批准太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）的 "星际飞船"（Starship）在三月份的爆炸测试事故后复飞，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的太空公司最快可在下周从得克萨斯州发射火星火箭的第九次试飞。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration on Thursday said it approved SpaceX's Starship to return to flight after its explosive testing mishap in March, allowing Elon Musk's space company to launch the Mars rocket's ninth test flight from Texas as soon as next week.】

item.title: 意大利相信美欧贸易协定将呼应美英协议
item.description: 意大利经济部长吉安卡洛-乔盖蒂（Giancarlo Giorgetti）周四表示，意大利相信美国将同意与欧盟达成一项类似于华盛顿已经与英国达成的贸易协议。【原文：Italy is confident the United States will agree to a trade deal with the European Union similar to the one Washington has already struck with Britain, Economy Minister Giancarlo Giorgetti said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国参议院投票否决加州 2035 年电动汽车法规
item.description: 美国参议院周四投票决定禁止加利福尼亚州到 2035 年停止销售纯汽油车的里程碑计划，该计划已被代表美国三分之一汽车市场的其他 11 个州采纳。【原文：The U.S. Senate on Thursday voted to bar California's landmark plan to end the sale of gasoline-only vehicles by 2035 that has been adopted by 11 other states representing a third of the U.S. auto market.】

item.title: 沃尔玛与塔吉特：关税凸显财富鸿沟日益扩大
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税正在扩大市场领导者沃尔玛和塔吉特（Target）之间的差距，两家公司的最新季报显示，这凸显了美国较小零售商在经济不确定性中的失策。【原文：President Donald Trump's tariffs are widening the gap between market-leader Walmart and Target, the companies' latest quarterly reports show, underscoring missteps at the smaller U.S. retailer amid economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 广告技术公司 MNTN 和投资者在美国首次公开募股中融资 1.872 亿美元
item.description: 营销技术公司 MNTN 和一些投资者周三表示，该公司在美国首次公开募股中募集到了 1.872 亿美元，为在 "解放日 "市场低迷中被推迟的另一次备受关注的上市创造了条件。【原文：Marketing tech firm MNTN and some investors raised $187.2 million in a U.S. initial public offering, the company said on Wednesday, setting the stage for another closely watched listing that was delayed amid the "Liberation Day" market downturn.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称美国国债抛售仍有序进行
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）发言人周四表示，美国国债市场保持有序，美国政府债券仍是流动性较好的避险资产。【原文：The U.S. Treasury market remains orderly and U.S. government bonds remain liquid safe-haven assets, a spokesperson at the International Monetary Fund said on Thursday, adding the Fund was monitoring tax plans taking shape in Congress.】

item.title: 美国机构投票决定禁止被认为存在安全风险的中国实验室测试美国电子产品
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会（Federal Communications Commission）周四以4比0的投票结果最终确定了禁止被认为对美国国家安全构成威胁的中国实验室在美国测试智能手机、照相机和电脑等电子设备的规定。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission voted on Thursday 4-0 to finalize rules barring Chinese labs deemed risks to U.S. national security from testing electronic devices such as smartphones, cameras and computers for use in the United States.】

item.title: 新的人工智能更新让 Alphabet 创下近三个月新高
item.description: 由于投资者对谷歌母公司的人工智能更新（包括向所有美国用户推出 "人工智能模式"）表示欢迎，Alphabet 股价周四大涨 4%，连续第二天上涨。【原文：Alphabet shares jumped 4% on Thursday, rising for a second straight day, as investors cheered the Google parent's artificial intelligence updates including the rolling out of "AI Mode" to all its U.S. users.】

item.title: 众议院预算法案有效扼杀了美国清洁能源的蓬勃发展
item.description: 众议院预算法案在周四清晨的投票中以微弱优势获得通过，该法案将有效遏制美国因 2022 年颁布的税收减免政策而掀起的清洁能源生产热潮。【原文：The House budget bill that narrowly passed in an early morning vote on Thursday would effectively put the brakes on a clean energy production boom in the United States spurred by tax credits enacted in 2022.】

item.title: 律师称美国应就 737 MAX 欺诈案起诉波音公司
item.description: 一些遇难者家属的律师说，美国司法部应就两起致命的 737 MAX 飞机坠毁事故引发的刑事欺诈案对波音公司进行审判，并拒绝接受允许该飞机制造商免于起诉的临时协议。【原文：The U.S. Justice Department should take Boeing to trial in a criminal fraud case stemming from two fatal 737 MAX crashes and reject a tentative deal to allow the planemaker to avoid prosecution, a lawyer for some of the victims' families said.】

item.title: 独家报道美国有望在贝莱德气候案中支持共和党各州的观点
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，美国联邦反垄断执法人员预计将于周四对共和党各州提出的指控资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）、先锋（Vanguard）和道富（State Street）通过气候激进主义合谋减少煤炭产量的论点表示支持。【原文：U.S. federal antitrust enforcers were expected to express support on Thursday for arguments wielded by Republican states that accuse asset managers BlackRock , Vanguard and State Street of conspiring through climate activism to decrease coal output, two sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：七国集团草案承诺应对全球经济 "过度失衡
item.description: 彭博新闻社周四援引一份公报草案报道称，七国集团财政部长和央行行长承诺解决全球经济 "过度失衡 "问题。【原文：Finance ministers and central bank governors from the Group of Seven nations pledged to address "excessive imbalances" in the global economy, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing a draft communique.】

item.title: 发动机供应商赛峰集团称波音已恢复 "动态 "生产模式
item.description: 波音737 MAX客机发动机制造商和主要供应商赛峰集团（Safran）负责人周四表示，在经历了多年737 MAX客机受挫的不确定性之后，美国飞机制造商波音公司已经恢复了更具 "活力 "的生产计划。【原文：U.S. planemaker Boeing has returned to a more "dynamic" production profile after years of uncertainty surrounding setbacks to its 737 MAX passenger jet, the head of engine maker and key Boeing supplier Safran said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 4 月成屋销售意外下滑
item.description: 尽管抵押贷款利率暂时下降且供应量增加，但美国 4 月份的成屋销售仍意外下降，而且在经济不确定性上升的情况下，今年的成屋销售可能依然乏善可陈。【原文：U.S. existing home sales unexpectedly fell in April despite a temporary drop in mortgage rates and increased supply, and could remain lackluster this year amid rising economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 阿联酋星际之门 "人工智能数据中心将于 2026 年开始运行
item.description: 位于阿拉伯联合酋长国的大型新人工数据中心一期工程将于 2026 年投入使用，届时可能会配备 10 万颗 Nvidia 芯片。【原文：The first phase of a massive new artificial data center in the United Arab Emirates will come online in 2026, likely with 100,000 Nvidia chips.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：Kraken 将允许以数字代币形式交易苹果、特斯拉和英伟达股票
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，加密货币交易所 Kraken 计划推出 50 多种股票和交易所交易基金的代币化版本，其中包括苹果、特斯拉、英伟达等公司的股票。【原文：Crypto exchange Kraken plans to launch tokenized versions of more than 50 stocks and exchange-traded funds, including shares of Apple , Tesla , Nvidia , the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 订阅管理平台 RevenueCat 获 5000 万美元 C 轮融资
item.description: 订阅管理平台 RevenueCat 周四获得了 5000 万美元的 C 轮融资，贝恩资本风险投资公司（Bain Capital Ventures）领投，Index Ventures、Y Combinator 和 Volo Ventures 等回归投资者也参与了投资。【原文：Subscription management platform RevenueCat on Thursday raised $50 million in Series C funding, led by Bain Capital Ventures, along with participation from returning investors Index Ventures, Y Combinator, and Volo Ventures among others.】

item.title: 美国 5 月商业活动改善；通胀有望大幅加速
item.description: 在华盛顿与中国的贸易战休战之际，美国 5 月份的商业活动有所回升，但唐纳德-特朗普总统对进口商品征收的全面关税提高了企业和消费者的价格。【原文：U.S. business activity picked up in May amid a truce in the trade war between Washington and China, but President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs on imported goods raised prices for companies and consumers.】

item.title: 福克斯商业》报道：美联储主席沃勒认为今年晚些时候有可能降息
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会理事克里斯托弗-沃勒（Christopher Waller）周四表示，他仍然认为今年晚些时候会有降息的可能，他的这番话表明，从市场定价水平来看，投资者担心共和党目前的预算计划不足以解决赤字问题。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said on Thursday he still sees a path to rate cuts later this year, in comments that observed market pricing levels show investors are worried current Republican budget plans are not doing enough to deal with the deficit.】

item.title: 研究显示，过去一年美国各年龄段和收入群体的实际收入停滞不前
item.description: 摩根大通研究所（JPMorganChase Institute）的一项研究得出结论：在过去的一年里，各年龄段和收入群体的通货膨胀调整后收入停滞不前，而COVID-19时代有时会出现的快速工资增长在五年后使工人整体的生活状况略有改善。【原文：Inflation-adjusted earnings stalled across age and income groups over the past year, while the sometimes rapid wage gains of the COVID-19 era have left workers as a whole little better off five years later, a JPMorganChase Institute study concluded.】

item.title: 房利美和房地美场外交易股价在特朗普发表分拆评论后飙升
item.description: 房利美（Fannie Mae）和房地美（Freddie Mac）的场外交易（OTC）股价周四大幅上涨，此前美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他正在考虑将这两家美国抵押贷款融资公司上市。【原文：Over-the-counter (OTC) shares in Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac rose sharply on Thursday after U.S. President Donald Trump said he was considering taking the U.S. mortgage finance firms public.】
